text: Philema Lemaire (7 July 1856 in Verberie, Oise, France – 6 May 1932 in Neuilly-Sur-Seine, Hauts-de-Seine, France) was a French politician. He was Governor General of Pondicherry in Second French Colonial Empire. Philema Lemaire, a member of Arthur Blocher's congregation, was also elected deputy in the French National Assembly (1907-14). ==References== Category:French colonial governors and administrators Category:Governors of French India Category:People of the French Third Republic Category:1856 births Category:1932 deaths Category:People from Oise
title: Philema Lemaire
